text: Is there support for something like [`field_name`](@ref struct_name) to refer to the field of a struct?

elements.text: Is there support for something like [
](@ref struct_name) to refer to the field of a struct?

text: I am not sure of your question.  If you could use a known `field_name` from a known `struct_name` to refer that named field within the named struct, what would you do with it that you cannot already do having both the struct name than the field name?  You can obtain the type of that field, but field values do not exist in `MyStruct`, they come into existence with `mystruct = MyStruct( value_of_ field )` as it is constructed.

text: I think Documenter lets you document fields of structs, so I just want a a cross-reference to that.
